content.question: ​The terms of the increasing arithmetic sequence <math alttext="a subscript n"><semantics><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> are positive. The terms of the increasing geometric sequence <math alttext="g subscript n"><semantics><msub><mi>g</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> are positive. The values of the first terms of both sequences are the same, and the values of the fourth terms of both sequences are the same. Which of the following statements describes the values of the second terms of the sequences?

choices.label: ​The second term of the arithmetic sequence must be less than the second term of the geometric sequence.
​The second term of the arithmetic sequence must be greater than the second term of the geometric sequence.
​The second term of the arithmetic sequence must be the same value as the second term of the geometric sequence.
​The relationship between the values of the second terms cannot be determined from the given information.

content.answer: ​The second term of the arithmetic sequence must be greater than the second term of the geometric sequence.
